message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This research is based on household survey data from the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study. We complement this dataset with information on local weather patterns and crop yields.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Labour Organization's Labour Force Survey and the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, we investigate the relationship between firm characteristics and job creation in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["International Labour Organization's Labour Force Survey", "World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We combine household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys with satellite imagery data to examine the relationship between women's health and access to water and sanitation facilities in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Health", "Water"]}, {"sentence": "To evaluate the impact of extractive industries on local economic development, we use a unique dataset provided by the Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative and gross value added data from national accounts.", "dataset": ["Extractive Industries Transparency Initiative"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "We construct a database that includes information from various sources such as the UNHCR and the Migration Policy Institute to examine the determinants and effects of refugee movements on host communities.", "dataset": ["UNHCR", "Migration Policy Institute"], "topic": ["Migration", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Using education data obtained from the UNESCO Institute for Statistics and Happiness Index data from the World Happiness Report, we analyze the impact of education on subjective well-being across countries.", "dataset": ["UNESCO Institute for Statistics"], "topic": ["Education", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We use a dataset from the World Bank's Microdata Library on access to credit by firm characteristics and gender to examine the role of financial inclusion in driving gender economic empowerment.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Microdata Library"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses data from the World Health Organization's Global Urban Ambient Air Pollution Database and household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys to evaluate the impact of air pollution on child health outcomes in urban areas of developing countries.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization's Global Urban Ambient Air Pollution Database", "Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Health", "Urban Development"]}, {"sentence": "We combine administrative data from the National Treasury and the Central Bank with survey data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys to examine the determinants and effects of non-performing loans on the financial sector in South Africa.", "dataset": ["National Treasury", "Central Bank", "World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study and the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis, we investigate the relationship between income inequality and carbon emissions across continents.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Living Standards Measurement Study", "International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Climate Change"]}]
